column1:
4.8.2.1	
Recommendation for the classification of urinary fistula

The risk of injury to the urinary tract and subsequent fistula formation is higher in women with 
malignant disease undergoing radical surgery than in women with benign disease undergoing simple 
surgical procedures.

The rate of fistula formation following external beam radiotherapy for gynaecological cancer appears 
to be of the same order as that following surgical treatment.
